thread.title: AIPMT re-test result 2015 declared today, Vipul tops, Khushi Tiwari 2nd; check cbseresults.nic.in, aipmt.nic.in for more
thread.title_full: AIPMT re-test result 2015 declared today, Vipul tops, Khushi Tiwari 2nd; check cbseresults.nic.in, aipmt.nic.in for more | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: AIPMT re-test result 2015 declared today, Vipul tops, Khushi Tiwari 2nd; check cbseresults.nic.in, aipmt.nic.in for more
text:
AIPMT re-test result 2015: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has declared AIPMT re-test result 2015 today (i.e. 17 th August) on its official website cbseresults.nic.in – test was re-conducted on July 25 after allegations of large-scale irregularities in the first test. Students can also check the result on aipmt.nic.in .
AIPMT (All India Pre-Medical/Pre-Dental Test) re-test was successfully conducted by CBSE on 25th July 2015. The Supreme Court accepted the CBSE’s plea seeking more time to re-conduct AIPMT 2015 . The SC directed CBSE to declare AIPMT results 2015 by 17th August.
Vipul from Haryana’s Jind district topped the exam while Khushi Tiwari from Rajasthan came second. Both the toppers are from the unreserved category, according to the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) which conducted the exam.
Khushi Tiwari, who prepared for the exam from Kota, scored 95.5 per cent (688/720). An elated Manmohan, her father, said, “I am proud of my daughter.”
32862 females and 32073 males cleared the AIPMT 2015 exam.
How to check AIPMT re-test result 2015?
1. Visit cbse.nic.in or go directly to cbseresults.nic.in.
2. Click ‘CBSE – ALL INDIA PMT/PDT ENTRANCE EXAMINATION 2015′
Students can also visit aipmt.nic.in and click ‘Result 2015′ given on left hand side.
3. Enter your roll number and date of birth in the boxes.
AIPMT results 2015: Enter your roll number and date of birth in the boxes given the site.
4. Click on ‘Submit’ button
Note: Students are advised to save the score card for further reference.
Initially, AIPMT entrance exam was held on May 03, 2015 but was cancelled by SC after it was revealed that the question paper was leaked and answer keys were circulated through electronic devices across 10 states.
“A total of 6,32,625 candidates were registered for this examination, out of which only 4,22,859 candidates downloaded the admit card. The examination was conducted at 1,065 centres in 50 cities throughout the country and abroad,” said higher officials of CBSE In statement issued.
The admission process of UG and PG Courses in various medical colleges across India is delayed this year and will start soon after the announcement of AIPMT results 2015.
A dress code was prescribed for the AIPMT re-test result 2015 and all the candidates were frisked prior to the examination.
More than one lakh officials had ensured the successful and fair conduct of examination, CBSE had said.
CBSE had also announced regular standard instructions for AIPMT, which was to carry only admit card with photograph affixed on it, postcard size photograph affixed on proforma and a passport size photograph for affixing on attendance sheet and no other materials.
There was a dress code applicable too to ensure no cheating happened.
 16, 2015 11:25 pm © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
